Well, the term immortal in books, myths, legends, etc is not well placed. See, a person that can eventually die is not an immortal. And there are really no immortals out there in the world. No matter what, there is a way to take down an immortal even if it is an impossible way. But they can be killed. Now, how they can be killed, depends.

Typically an eraser or White-out will do the trick when the immortal is in a script or a book. If the immortal is in a non-digital movie, you may have to destroy the tape. A digital movie just needs the right editing software to remove the immortal. E-Books likely just need to be deleted as you usually can’t edit those.

Hm, when there is some kind of way to get rid of his Immortality, then do this. If souls exist, try to destroy the immortals soul, this basically the same as being dead. If not, break their spirit so they want to die. Otherwise destroy their body in a way it can’t regenrate, like being thrown into an active volcano or something like this. If nothing else works, try to throw the immortal into a black hole.

“How do you kill an immortal?” It depends on how immortality is defined. For example, if by immortality is meant total disengagement, then if I consign this immortal to endlessly working out Pi to its final digit, then this immortal would effectively be dead because the immortal would not have the time or opportunity to engage in the world of people. Depends. If it is an immortal from one of the many mythologies, religions, or beliefs, I suggest reading up on it. There are specific ways to kill immortals, such as a stake through the heart for vampires, or a god and a mortal working together to kill a giant. Basically what I’m saying is… do some research!

Immortals are part of mythology. Read the mythology you are interested in, possibly Greek mythology. At some point one of the stories will tell you a method. Those stories may have some wisdom for today’s living, but mostly they are for entertainment. For a serious study of mythology read some of the writings of Joseph Campbell.

Somebody immortal, by definition, cannot die. Though unless this person or being has superpowers or is incredibly elusive, there are ways of subduing them (capture, torture, exile, or as suggested, throwing them into a black hole).

You don’t kill an immortal, you imprison them so they can’t do any mischief. There are a number of Olympian Titans jailed right now in Tartarus who will never die. But they will also never have any effect on humanity because they’re too far down. Unless, of course, someone figures out a way to release them.
cut him or her into little pieces . jar them with salt and ship them off all over the world . burn half and eat the good bits .

That depends on the type of immortality & the lore of the universe this is taking place in. For instance, in South Park, Kenny's body can only stay dead if he dies by natural causes (although his soul stays within the remains, not advancing to the afterlife), but in the event of any unnatural death, he will be reborn hours later.
You don't need to. Just bury them in cement or wrap them in chains and drop them in the ocean. Not dead but no longer an issue.
